bug.author: QuellaZhang
bug.summary: MLPACK failed due to link error on MSVC
bug.description:
MLPACK failed due to link error with MSVC on windows. I use latest version <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/commit/aa2f59fa24350db5a2f7b5ca3a2d0ee2d6bb1626>aa2f59f</denchmark-link> . Could you please help look at this? Thanks a lot! You can repro this issue as the steps below:
git clone https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack D:\MLPACK\src it dependent armadillo and OpenBlas, put them to D:\MLPACK\external\ open a VS 2017 amd64 command prompt as admin and browse to D:\MLPACK mkdir build_x64 && pushd build_x64 cmake -G "Visual Studio 16 2019" -A x64 -DBLAS_LIBRARY=D:\MLPACK\build_x64..\external\OpenBLAS.0.2.14.1\lib\native\lib\x64\libopenblas.dll.a -DLAPACK_LIBRARY=D:\MLPACK\build_x64..\external\OpenBLAS.0.2.14.1\lib\native\lib\x64\libopenblas.dll.a -DARMADILLO_INCLUDE_DIR=D:\MLPACK\build_x64..\external\armadillo-9.200.4\include -DARMADILLO_LIBRARY=D:\MLPACK\build_x64..\external\armadillo-9.200.4\lib\armadillo.lib -DBOOST_INCLUDEDIR=C:\boost_1_67_0\x64 -DBOOST_LIBRARYDIR=C:\boost_1_67_0\x64\lib64-msvc-14.1 -DDEBUG=OFF -DPROFILE=OFF ..\src msbuild /m /p:Configuration=Release;Platform=x64;PreferredToolArchitecture=x64 mlpack.sln /t:Rebuild
build log: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/files/4621418/mlpack_build.log>mlpack_build.log</denchmark-link>
Failures: Creating library F:/mlpack/build_amd64/Release/mlpack_emst.lib and object F:/gitP/mlpack/mlpack/build_amd64/Release/mlpack_emst.exp emst_main.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol dasum_ emst_main.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol dnrm2_ emst_main.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol dgesdd_ F:\mlpack\build_amd64\Release\mlpack_emst.exe : fatal error LNK1120: 3 unresolved externals

comments.comment: This looks similar to: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/881>#881</denchmark-link> maybe you can test: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/881#issuecomment-282397637>#881 (comment)</denchmark-link> ?

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zoq>@zoq</denchmark-link> , we have added BLAS lib in cmake build commad line. Recently we updated the sha of MLPACK, the old commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/commit/2e2e0f59cd262b731218b4a35999db361e2999e1>2e2e0f5</denchmark-link> is work fine on the same version of MSVC, if you have any other suggestions please let me know, thanks.

Sorry for the slow response, just to see if I get this right, you say the version <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/commit/2e2e0f59cd262b731218b4a35999db361e2999e1>2e2e0f5</denchmark-link> works fine, but the current master branch is not? If that's the case let me see if I can find a change in the history that might have caused an issue like this.

What happens if you specify _ARMADILLO_LIBRARIES=/path/to/openblas.lib as a CMake variable? i.e. cmake ... -D_ARMADILLO_LIBRARIES=/path/to/openblas.lib ...? Does that fix the issue? I think, if so, I know what the fix needs to be. üëç

Thank you very much, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zoq>@zoq</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> , I also find the version <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/commit/97fd462a98a66e52e41720f9954f2dd7d901c466>97fd462</denchmark-link> , I have updated the cmake commands, now MLPACK is clean on MSVC.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> before this stales and is lost to time, what fix are you proposing?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/birm>@birm</denchmark-link> good point, I didn't actually specify what I meant. I think that we could just modify such that when the compiler is MSVC, all of the support libraries are automatically added to (even if is set!), and this would cause the problem <denchmark-link:https://github.com/QuellaZhang>@QuellaZhang</denchmark-link> had to not occur.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had any recent activity. It will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions! üëç
